TEXT.TITLE: P.S. INDIANA <PIN> TO REDEEM DOUBLE-DIGIT DEBT
TEXT.BODY: Public Service Co of Indiana Inc said it acted today to replace 35 mln dlrs in existing debt, estimating that would save it about 1.8 mln dlrs a year. The utility said it plans to issue a 35 mln dlr, 7.6 pct first mortgage bond, Series NN, due 2012 to the city of Princeton, Ind. The Series NN bonds will serve as collateral to Princeton's equal-sized pollution control bond issue that are expected to have the same interest rate. Proceeds from this issue will be used to redeem the utility's 12-3/4 pct bonds that serve as collateral for Princeton's same-rate pollution control bonds. Reuter
